entry.title: genre sombre cemetery backpack accessory
entry.content:
2023/03/18 B1 Key Vocabulary List

2023/03/18

1.exempt       

US /ɪɡˈzempt/

to excuse someone or something from a duty, payment, etc.

Employees who earn less than $23,660 per year are exempt from overtime pay requirements under the Fair Labor Standards Act.

2.salmon       

US /ˈsæm.ən/

a medium-sized silver-coloured fish that lives in the sea or rivers and swims up rivers to produce its eggs. Its pink flesh is eaten as a food.

salmon fishing

3.knuckle       

US /ˈnʌk.əl/

關節or腳

pig knuckle.

4.mentality       

US /menˈtæl.ə.t̬i/

a person’s particular way of thinking about things

I can't understand the mentality of people who hurt animals.

5.kebab       

US /kəˈbɑːb/

a shish kebab/肉串

Most were takeaway outlets selling kebab sandwiches and dips.

entry.title: English Tutorial with Aleksandar
entry.content:
2023/03/17 Conversation

2023/03/17

English Tutorial with Aleksandar;

Here are some words or phrases you can use to indicate agreement:

“Yes, I agree.”

“That’s right.”

“Exactly.”

“I couldn’t agree more.”

“You’re absolutely right.”

“I see your point.”

“I’m with you on this.”

“That makes sense to me.”

“I’m in complete agreement.”

“I agree wholeheartedly.”

The example of distinguishes.

“I’m not sure what distinguishes A from B.”

“Could you explain the distinction between A and B to me?”

“I’m having trouble telling A apart from B.”

“I’m confused about the difference between A and B.”

Are you busy in a weekday?

I'm available during weekdays. Is there something specific you need help with or would like to schedule a meeting for?

Yes, I am always busy during weekdays because I am an engineer and my job is exempt, so sometimes I need to work from 8 AM to 8 PM.

what do you usually do with friends?

I usually go to bars with my friends on weekends, and sometimes we have cocktails before moving on to the next bar. This could be considered an alcohol tour.

what song do you usually sing?

Recently, I have been singing the song 'Bad Habits'

I have been listening to his songs since my elementary school days.

so which one more better?current or your former company.

``

so what do you do in your free times?

``

do you work sometimes on weekends?i hopes not.

``

how is the wheather in taichung?

``

how about the typhoon seasons?

``

where do you work ,sorry if you don't mind i'm asking.

``

entry.title: genre sombre cemetery backpack accessory
entry.content:
2023/02/27 B1 Key Vocabulary List

2023/02/27

1.genre       

US /ˈʒɑ̃ː.rə/

a style, especially in the arts, that involves a particular set of characteristics

What genre does the book fall into - comedy or tragedy?

2.immune       

US /ɪˈmjuːn/

protected against a particular disease by particular substances in the blood

He seems to be immune to colds - he just never gets them.

3.handkerchief       

US /ˈhæŋ.kɚ.tʃiːf/

a square piece of cloth or paper used for cleaning the nose or drying the eyes when they are wet with tears

She took out her handkerchief and blew her nose loudly.

4.tracksuit       

US /ˈtræk.suːt/

a loose top and trousers, worn either by people who are training for a sport or exercising, or as informal clothing

They can wear this with shorts or a tracksuit.

5.scarf       

US /skɑːrf/

shoulders to keep you warm or to make you look attractive

He had a woollen scarf around his neck.

entry.title: curious sombre cemetery backpack accessory
entry.content:
2023/02/13 B1 Key Vocabulary List

2023/02/13

1.curious       

US /ˈkjʊə.ri.əs/

interested in learning about people or things around you

I was curious to know what would happen next.

2.sombre       

US /ˈsɒm.bər/

serious, sad, and without humour or entertainment

She remembered Ann's instruction not to be late.

I left them in a sombre mood.

3.cemetery       

US /rɪˈsep.ʃən.ɪst/

an area of ground in which dead bodies are buried

We came across a run-down cemetery, full of tumbled gravestones.

4.backpack       

US /ˈbæk.pæk/

a large bag used to carry things on your back, used especially by people who go camping or walking

It's a frame backpack with a belt and padded shoulder straps.

5.accessory       

US /əkˈses.ər.i/

something added to a machine or to clothing that has a useful or decorative purpose

Sunglasses are much more than a fashion accessory.

entry.title: Effortless English
entry.content:
2023/02/12 The Seven rule of Effortless english

2023/02/09
1. Stop studying English words.

Native speakers do not learn English by remembering single words. Native speakers learn phrases. Phrases are GROUPS of words that naturally go together.

  • RULE 1: Always Study and Review Phrases, Not Individual Words Never study a single, individual word.
2. Don’t Study Grammar

Grammar rules teach you to think about English, you want to speak automatically– without thinking!

3. The Most Important Rule– Listen First

You must listen to UNDERSTANDABLE English. You must listen to English EVERYDAY. Don’t read textbooks. Listen to English.

  • Learn With Your Ears, Not Your Eyes Spend most of your study time listening- that is the key to great speaking.
4. Slow, Deep Learning Is Best

Hyun learned a lot of words in a short time. Her learning was short and shallow. That’s why she quickly forgot the words. That’s why she could not use them. The secret to speaking easily is to learn every word & phrase DEEPLY.

How do you learn deeply?

Easy just repeat all lessons or listening many times.

For example, if you have an audio book, listen to the first chapter 30 times before you go to the second chapter.

You could listen to the first chapter 3 times each day,for 10 days.

5. Use Point Of View Mini-Stories

I call these stories “Point Of View Mini-Stories”. They are the most powerful way to learn and use English grammar automatically.

You must learn grammar by listening to real English. The best way is to listen to the same story… told in different times (points of view)

6. You Must Learn Real English

Stop Learning Textbook English,To learn real English, you must listen to English that native speakers listen to. You must watch what they watch. You must read what they

Use real magazines, audio articles, TV shows, movies, radio talk shows, and audio books.

7. Listen and Answer, not Listen and Repeat

I told her that listen and repeat is not enough when you repeat, you only copy the speaker. But when you hear a question and you ANSWER it you must think in English.

How can you use Listen & Answer Stories?

Easy! Find a native speaker tutor. Ask him to use this method: Ask him to tell a story… and to constantly ask you easy questions about it. This will teach you to think quickly in English!
entry.summary: 2023/02/12 The Seven rule of Effortless english

entry.title: ordering food
entry.content:
2023/02/09 Conversation

2023/02/09

ordering food;

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lEF7tkTn1YE

Good evening are you ready to order?

sure

Would you like to start with an appetizer?

Yes.I want a salad. What kind of salad do you have?

We have fruit salad,caesar salad with chicken and green salad.What do you want?

Is there oil on the green salad?

Yes,We use a lot of olive oil for thar dish.

Can I have a green salad without the oil?

Sure.But maybe the taste will not be good.

What's in the salad?

It contains carrots,peppers,onions and lettuce.

Right.It will be very pale without olive oil.

I recommend a mixed green salad with fruit,It will taste better.

Good idea,I'll have that.

What about the main dishes?

What are today's special?

Today we have grill fish,shrimp hamburger with chilies sauces and tacos.

What is the sauce made of?

It's made from chilies,pepper and mayonnaise.

I can eat spicily,I think I'll have grill fish.

It is served with a choice of rice or mashed potatoes.What is your choice?

Hmm rice,please.

Is there anything else?

a bowl of pumpkin soup,please.

Okay,Do you want anything to drink?

A bottle of mineral water,please.

Alright.Would you like some desserts?

What do you have for dessert today?

We have brownies,ice cream and fruits.

I want an ice cream,a vanilla ice cream,please.

Is that all?你還要別的嗎?

No,How long will the dish come out?

It's about 30 minutes.I'll bring you the drink first.

Okay.

``

``

entry.title: mechanic roundabout motorway thunderstorm journalist
entry.content:
2023/02/09 A2 Key Vocabulary List

2023/02/09

1.secretary       

US /ˈsek.rə.ter.i/

someone who works in an office, writing letters, making phone calls, and arranging meetings for a person or for an organization

Their conversations were taken down in shorthand by a secretary.

2.instruction       

US /ɪnˈstrʌk.ʃən/

  1. something that someone tells you to do

She remembered Ann's instruction not to be late.

  1. advice and information about how to do or use something, often written in a book or on the side of a container

You obviously didn't read the instructions properly.

3.receptionist       

US /rɪˈsep.ʃən.ɪst/

a person who works in a place such as a hotel, office, or hospital, who welcomes and helps visitors and answers the phone

Meet Sarah, who works as a receptionist at a large financial services company.

4.scarf       

US /skɑːrf/

  1. a strip, square, or triangle of cloth, worn around the neck, head, or shoulders to keep you warm or to make you look attractive

2.to eat something quickly and eagerly Lunch is usually scarfed down in five minutes before they run out to play.

He had a woollen scarf around his neck.

5.institution       

US /ˌɪn.stəˈtuː.ʃən/

a large and important organization, such as a university or bank

Harvard University is an internationally respected institution.

entry.title: lettuce appetizer gather pepper thought
entry.content:
2023/02/08 A2 Key Vocabulary List

2023/02/08

1.lettuce       

US /ˈlet.ɪs/

a plant with large, green leaves, eaten uncooked in salads

I'd like a ham sandwich on rye, hold the lettuce.

2.appetizer       

US /ˈæp.ə.taɪ.zər/

a small amount of food eaten before a meal

At 6.30 everyone gathered for drinks and appetizers in the lounge.

3.gather       

US /ˈɡæð.ər/

to collect several things, often from different places or people

I went to several libraries to gather information about the plans.

4.pepper       

US /ˈpep.ər/

a red/green pepper

Red peppers are ideal for roasting in the oven.

5.thought       

US /θɑːt/

an idea or opinion, or a set of ideas about a particular subject

Ask me again tomorrow. I'll have to give it some thought.

entry.title: mechanic roundabout motorway thunderstorm journalist
entry.content:
2023/02/06 A2 Key Vocabulary List

2023/02/06

1.mechanic       

UK /məˈkæn.ɪk/

someone whose job is repairing the engines of vehicles and other machines

At that time she was just a humble mechanic.

2.roundabout       

UK /ˈraʊnd.ə.baʊt/

  1. a place where three or more roads join and traffic must go around a circular area in the middle, rather than straight across

  2. not in a simple, direct, or quick way

He asked me, in a roundabout way, if he could have a salary increase.

3.motorway       

UK /ˈməʊ.tə.weɪ/

a wide road for fast-moving traffic, especially in the UK, Ireland, and some other countries, with a limited number of places at which drivers can enter and leave it

Because of the bad weather, motorway (driving) conditions are expected to be hazardous tonight.

4.thunderstorm station       

UK /ˈθʌn.də.stɔːm/

a storm with thunder and lightning and usually heavy rain

This is like whistling into a thunderstorm and expecting the sky to clear.

5.journalist       

UK /ˈdʒɜː.nə.lɪst/

a person who writes news stories or articles for a newspaper or magazine or broadcasts them on radio or television

The journalist asked the minister how he viewed recent events.

entry.title: suitcase helicopter garage tram petrol station

link.title: suitcase helicopter garage tram petrol station

entry.content:
2023/02/02 A2 Key Vocabulary List

2023/02/02

1.suitcase       

UK /ˈsuːt.keɪs/

a large, rectangular container with a handle, for carrying clothes and possessions while travelling

The suitcase was full of dollar bills .

2.helicopter       

UK /ˈhel.ɪˌkɒp.tər/

a type of aircraft without wings, that has one or two sets of large blades that go round very fast on top. It can land and take off vertically and can stay in one place in the air

The injured were ferried to hospital by helicopter.

3.garage       

UK /ˈɡær.ɑːʒ/

a building where a car is kept, built next to or as part of a house

Did you put the car in the garage?

4.petrol station       

UK /ˈpet.rəl ˌsteɪ.ʃən/

a place where fuel is sold for road vehicles, often with a small shop

A small shop is attached to the petrol station.

5.tram       

UK /ˈsen.tʃər.i/

an electric vehicle that transports people, usually in cities, and goes along metal tracks in the road

Train use remained stable, but the use of trams and trolley-buses declined almost to nothing.
